reply.question: 2. If the app declares the collection of data, what type of data does it collect?

answer.full_answer: The app collects Browser or platform type, IP address, referring site, Location information, Transactional information, Billing information, Device information, and Account information.

reply.analysis: The app collects various types of data, including information related to the device, transactional details, and account information, to provide optimized services and manage accounts.
reply.reference: Browser or platform type, IP address, referring site, Location Information, Transactional Information, Billing Information, Device Information, and Account Information. URL: https://www.parenityapp.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 3. Does the app declare the purpose of data collection and use?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the app declares the purpose of data collection and use. The collected data is used for various purposes such as registration, delivering services, communication, compliance with contractual obligations, sending important notices, research and development, verifying identity, conducting surveys, marketing, promotions, advertising activities, monitoring online activity, and to improve the user experience. Additionally, the app may use cookies, web beacons, and other tracking mechanisms to optimize services, manage accounts, and develop content.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly outlines the various purposes for which data is collected and used by the app, including essential functions like registration and communication, as well as marketing, research, and improving user experience.
reply.reference: We collect your personal information for the following purposes. i. To register you with us. ii. To deliver you services you have applied for. iii. To communicate with you. iv. To comply with the contractual obligations. v. To send you important notices in lieu of services. vi. For research and development. vii. To verify your identity. viii. To conduct surveys and research. ix. To conduct marketing, promotions, and advertising activities. x. To monitor online activity on Company’s properties. xi. To market, improve and... reply.question: 4. Can the user opt out of data collection or delete data?

answer.full_answer: Yes, the user can opt out of data collection or delete data by uninstalling the app or by contacting the company directly.

reply.analysis: The privacy policy clearly states that users can stop all collection of information by the app by uninstalling it or by contacting the company to request deletion of their personal information.
reply.reference: You can stop all collection of information by the App(s) by uninstalling the App(s). You may access and modify the Personal Information associated with your Account through your Account settings. If you want us to delete your Personal Information and your Account, please contact us at hello@parenityapp.com with your request. URL: https://www.parenityapp.com/privacy-policy

reply.question: 6. If the app shares data with third parties, what third parties does the app share data with?

answer.full_answer: The app shares data with third party vendors, third parties to whom users demand to send Personal Information, affiliates, partners, subsidiaries, joint ventures, other companies, and third-party payment processors.

content: third parties to whom users demand to send Personal Information

reply.analysis: The privacy policy document specifies that the app shares data with various third parties for different purposes.
